column5: Does anyone know if the Pigeon River crossing (south of Thunder Bay) has a Nexus cardholder lane? -Thanks
It did not have one last year at this time.
The NEXUS program allows pre-screened travelers expedited processing by United States and Canadian officials at dedicated processing lanes at designated northern border ports of entry.

I looked into this further and there's a $50 fee for the card - plus all the other supporting evidence and application work - and I could find how long it will be valid. a s of now it's seems mainly for air travel not so much car entry. we flew into thunder bay thru Toronto last year and experienced a wait of maybe 10 minutes at customs in Toronto - will be flying to TB again via Toronto in about 10 days and will check to see what the situation is. my first thought is that its doesn't seem to be worth it. does anyone else have any experience with this card or think it's worth it? thanks, phish
I was traveling back and forth to Canada for business, so it was worth it for me. They are good for five years. Unless you go back and forth a lot it probably is not worth the trouble to get.
thanks! I agree, for those of us who go once or twice a year is probably not worth it. phish
